DataElement.preferredName: Local Pathology Review Well Differentiated Neuroendocrine Lesion Bronchial Origin Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator whether there is a neoplastic lesion with neuroendocrine differentiation and well differentiated histological features of a bronchial origin by local pathology review as a criteria required to be eligible to participate in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Local Pathology Review Well Differentiated Neuroendocrine Lesion Bronchial Origin Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Microscopic examination of tissue specimen(s) by a pathologist in the local institution where a patient had a procedure performed, using local standardized methods and criteria._A neoplastic lesion with neuroendocrine differentiation and well differentiated histological features._Of, or pertaining to, the bronchus._The place where something begins or comes from in either the sense of a physical location or a metaphysical source._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Microscopic examination of tissue specimen(s) by a pathologist in the local institution where a patient had a procedure performed, using local standardized methods and criteria.

Concepts.definition: Microscopic examination of tissue specimen(s) by a pathologist in the local institution where a patient had a procedure performed, using local standardized methods and criteria.

Property.preferredName: Well Differentiated Neuroendocrine Lesion Bronchial Origin Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A neoplastic lesion with neuroendocrine differentiation and well differentiated histological features.:Of, or pertaining to, the bronchus.:The place where something begins or comes from in either the sense of a physical location or a metaphysical source.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A neoplastic lesion with neuroendocrine differentiation and well differentiated histological features.
Of, or pertaining to, the bronchus.
The place where something begins or comes from in either the sense of a physical location or a metaphysical source.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 12/3/2020: CM Released as part of draft content review

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
